intro: Codonoboea doryphylla, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, white or yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are usually narrow and hairy. Codonoboea doryphylla is often found in coastal or mountainous regions where it thrives in well-drained conditions.
